page.title: 19LIFESTYLE IN BOWERCHALKE
page.content: Nearly a half of all households have moved here within the last 15 years. People choose to live here for its peace, its clean air & beautiful surroundings. It provides many varied walks on ancient trackways and foot- paths, often maintained by residents.Youths occasionally ride on these paths on motor bikes. Litter is collected by the Women's Institute, but , so far, the "Best Kept Village" has escaped us. For the Elderly, there is a monthly Club, and a weekly Day Centre serves the whole Chalke Valley. There is no sport facility for child- ren & young people. Baptist & Anglican Churches have loyal following. A Mobile Library visits fortnightly. Day -time classes are held in Dressmaking, Upholstery & Art. The whole Village comes together for the Annual Flower & Produce Show held in August.
